modules.description: Provides SHA1, SHA256, and SHA512 hash computation functions, along with digest manipulation and conversion utilities. Works with byte sequences and hexadecimal strings for input and output. Used to generate cryptographic hashes for data integrity checks and secure identifier generation.

The module provides SHA-512 hashing operations, including context management, incremental updates via strings/buffers/files, and digest computation, with support for parallel processing and high-performance C-based implementations. It handles low-level data structures like contexts, buffers, and digests, alongside hexadecimal string conversions for seamless integration. Use cases include secure data integrity checks, cryptographic protocol implementations, and efficient processing of large datasets through optimized parallel workflows.

The module provides SHA-256 hashing with context management, enabling updates via strings, buffers, or files and finalizing cryptographic digests. It supports conversions between binary, hexadecimal, and digest representations, alongside types for handling contexts, buffers, and parsed hash values. Use cases include verifying data integrity, securing communications, and managing cryptographic workflows with safe and unsafe update mechanisms.

This module offers SHA-1 hashing operations, including context management, incremental data updates, and digest finalization, working with Bigarray buffers, strings, files, and I/O channels. It supports converting digests between binary, hexadecimal, and file formats, enabling secure hash computation for tasks like data integrity checks or cryptographic workflows. Specific use cases include processing large datasets incrementally, serializing hash outputs for storage, and handling binary data through low-level buffer manipulations.
